name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Austin Northwest/Arboretum

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel 4-6 times per year for the past several years. It under went a remodel about four years ago and is holding up well. More recently the breakfast area was opened up to provide more room. It's a practical change that works, but do miss the old gas fireplace. Myriad dining choices nearby, and with the opening of the Domain shopping area, this hotel is convenient to some of the newest, hippest shopping Austin has to offer. The staff is courteous, friendly and helpful. While rarely an issue, it has been my experience this hotel takes seriously quest comfort and will enforce its noise policy. The business center has one computer and printer. Overall, in my opinion, a good value and convenient location.
reviews.title: Good value and Convenient Location

reviews.text: Other than trying to figure out how to access the place off the MoPac, it was great!
reviews.title: Nice place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Though, when I walked into my room is was below 55 degrees! And the AC was still on! Someone had turned the thermostat all the way down. In 20 mins, with some heat, everything was fixed.
reviews.title: Good but not perfect accomodation for the price

reviews.text: I am on the train side of the hotel, and well, I work on a train, so it doesn't bother me. In fact, I didn't wake up once. I had to laugh though, all the other reviews talk like the hotel should move the tracks. Yeah, right.
reviews.title: Friendly Roomy Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only complaint I can come up with is, the internet connections aren't good. .25mbs download speed is crappy and to claim it as "high speed" ??
reviews.title: Comfy Clean Room, Great staff!
Nice hotel.
reviews.text: Our stay was for only one night. The hotel was very nice and very clean. We had a very enjoyable stay and was close to the event we were in Austin for. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Good restuarants are close by and fairly easy to get to. The only problem we had, was initially the place was a litte hard to get to, but we quickly learned our way around. We would definately stay there again.

This hotel was convenient since we were going to Pickle Research Center, the Domain, and a golf course in Round Rock. Otherwise, it is pretty far north from downtown Austin. Clean rooms, very friendly and accomodating staff, good stay.
reviews.title: Nice room, good value, friendly front desk staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thought this Fairfield Inn seemed newer and nicer than others we've stayed in. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet was more complete than many hotels in this category.
reviews.title: A very good experience

reviews.text: We overlooked the parking lot, so we didn't have any problems with the trains (as others have referenced). It does seem to be a very active train track.
reviews.title: Above par for Fairfield Inn - very clean and fresh

likes.liked: — Very clean, free amenities like Internet
likes.disliked: — Difficult to get to if unfamiliar with Texas frontage roads

reviews.title: Lazy housekeeping
reviews.text: Location is great-- easy access to many of the major roads.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here because a family member had reserved a discount block of rooms for a wedding. I read the other reviews first and knew about the train, but got the impression it was some kind of toy. It is a freight train. The hotel staff seems oblivious to it. It goes by about every hour during the night and blows the whistle and you can hear the rumbling. It is only about 200 feet from the hotel. The other side of the hotel is near the highway, but our relatives said that with the A/C running you could not hear the traffic. Choose the highway side. Otherwise, the staff is friendly and the hotel is clean. Breakfast was fine -cereal, waffles, yogurt.
reviews.title: Freight Train

likes.liked: — Convenient to the event I was attending; not too far from downtown Austin
likes.disliked: — Location near rails; somewhat hard to get to from highway, but that's Texas for you

reviews.title: 2nd review
reviews.text: This was my second stay at Fairfield Inn Northwest and it was as pleasant as the first. When I booked the room for Jan 19th the rate was $69 each night until the night of the 21st when it jumped to $127. So, I just booked the room online for the 19th and 20th. On the morning of the 21st, I asked the hotel desk if I could stay one more night at the discounted rate and they were very nice in agreeing to the extra night at $69.
I stayed in room #107. Both times I have stayed here, my room was on the first floor, west side - so I don't know anything about the trains mentioned in earlier reviews.
reviews.title: Like trains?

reviews.text: If you stay when the hotel is offering the discounted rate, it is a real bargain.
reviews.title: Great staff!

aka: Fairfield Inn & Suites Austin Northwest Hotel Austin
